channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2024030518
item.description:
Report E-2024030518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: SANDSTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Starlite Built Liquid Alkali was released from (1) 55-gallon DF due to the cap coming off of the drum. The release impacted the top of the drum only. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Hepaco arrived on site and neutralized the impacted area on top of the impacted drum. Once cleaned and neutralized, Hepaco replaced the damaged cap with a new one and ensured it was on tight. All 4 drums were then resecured and shrink-wrapped. One 30-gallon DF of waste was generated containing impacted absorbent pads and PPE.

item.title: Report X-2024030702
item.description:
Report X-2024030702

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: ASHLAND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE QA CAGE FROM THE UNLOAD. THE CONTENTS WAS MISSING A TOP AND ANOTHER HAD A HOLE AT THE TOP. DescribePack: NOT CLOSURE AND A PUNCTURED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM AND MOVED TO HAZMAT CAGE FOR STORAGE

item.title: Report X-2024030912
item.description:
Report X-2024030912

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: SOUTH CHESTERFIELD
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Packages were found on the trailer by qa and were leaking paint. All three of the packages were immediately pulled off the trailer and placed in hazmat totes. The team then proceeded to clean all of the paint off the trailer and packages. DescribePack: The lids on the drums were popped off while in transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All three of the packages were immediately pulled off the trailer and placed in hazmat totes. The team then proceeded to clean all of the paint off the trailer and packages.

item.title: Report X-2024030706
item.description:
Report X-2024030706

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: MANASSAS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was a repack from the night before in which the original box got wet from another damaged package. It was found after 4 a.m. inside of TZ trailer 830664 by the unload manager in which was then given to QA's attention. 1 of the 4 jugs of concentrated driveway and concrete pressure wash had its lid come off, resulting in the liquid spilling out and soiling the packaging. DescribePack: The admin found the cap of one of the four jugs had come off and the liquid inside gone. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Made sure the rest of the lids were closed tightly.

item.title: Report E-2024030390
item.description:
Report E-2024030390

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: LYNCHBURG
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While driver was unloaded fuel she was using coaxle fitting with no cap on top. Driver overfilled tank due to not referring to Eagle conversion booklet for fit. Gas spilled out of the top of the coaxle fitting. CDG was contacted and managed the response/cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024030691
item.description:
Report X-2024030691

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: WINCHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat package was found already broken by package handlers who were unloading a trailer around 6:30AM. They immediately noticed a smell and notified hazmat trained personnel to come and contain the hazmat. DescribePack: One 16 Oz glass bottle was broken in the box with its contents spilled all over the rest of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately removed from the unloading area and brought to the hazmat cage by trained personnel.
